div.p: To the Gardeners' Chronicle and Agricultural Gazette

Letter not found. For the text given here, see 'Foreign Correspondence', Gardeners' chronicle and agricultural gazette , 25 February 1865, p. 174 (B65.02.05). It is dated to January as the latest likely date for it to have been sent to be published in this issue. See also M to J. Lindley, 21 January 1865 (in this edition as 65-01-21a).
Gastrolobium grandiflorum . — This year large flocks have started for the Flinders,
Flinders River, Qld. See also M to the Gardeners' chronicle and agricultural gazette, 25 July 1864 (in this edition as 64-07-25c). and on the road out have had frightful losses from this poisonous Gastrolobe. It is most destructive, and for a death dealer I do not think it has been surpassed. It is fatal to cattle as well as sheep. Some drop as soon as they eat it; others dash madly into the bush and are seen no more; but most of them show no symptoms of it till the morning after they have eaten of it, when they drop in hundreds.
